Comments_List:
In addition to the maintenance of my Japanese skill from previous semesters, I was introduced to a lot of primary writings in Japanese such as newspapers, movie scripts, famous short stories, proverbs, poems, etc. 
I also learned a lot of new kanji pertaining to a variety of topics such as politics and culture.
Continued learning Japanese through a variety of media

I think that the range of sources and projects were very well thought out. We watched movies, read excerpts, made formal news reports, and much more. The structure was also very well done. There were sometimes I felt that the kanji being learned was very niche, but in a given situation they could be useful.
I would like to see more dedicated speaking practice, and I think verbal skills should account for a larger portion of the grade. Otherwise the class is superb.

Yes, this is a great way to practice reading, writing, and speaking. We not only learned the language, but also integrated aspects of culture, politics, and society in Japan that many people wouldn't normally know about.
Yes! Take classes in the Japanese department! It really is the best!
